name: quiveringly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
with a slight shaking movement, often because of strong emotion or physical weakness: A hundred thousand lights were reflected quiveringly upon the black flowing waters.
in a way that shows very strong feelings and understanding : The songs are both quiveringly simple and highly expressive. He is cultured and well read, quiveringly attuned to the arty and the sensual.
More examplesFewer examplesShe writes in quiveringly passionate language that accurately reflects the sensibility of her teenage narrator.The rabbit suddenly sat up, her normally floppy ears quiveringly erect. He checked each room carefully, every sense quiveringly alert, but they were all empty.
